subject: Self Care
title: Sleep and the Immune System
description: A short lesson to help you apply Sleep and the Immune System.

hook.text: People who sleep less than six hours are four times more likely to catch a cold when exposed to the virus.

buildup.text: During sleep, the immune system releases cytokines â€” proteins that fight infection and inflammation.

discovery.text: Sleep deprivation reduces natural killer cell activity, your front line against viruses and tumors.

twist.text: Vaccines work less effectively in sleep-deprived people. The immune system needs sleep to learn threats.

climax.text: Consistent sleep is one of the cheapest, most effective immune boosters available to every human.

punchline.text: Sleep is free medicine. Take the full dose nightly.

quiz.question: How does sleep deprivation affect vaccine effectiveness?
options: The immune system needs sleep to build antibodies properly
